channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 x substantial potholes, 17th May
item.description:
2 major potholes potentially dangerous to cyclists. Previously reported.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Saint Anne's Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes on road Junction, 17th May
item.description:
Numerous potholes 10 + on Junction causing a danger to cyclists. Previously reported but only one hole fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Askham Court Pittville Circus Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: State of the road, 17th May
item.description:
Road & pavements on Holtham Avenue are appalling. Curbs falling off, pavements & road are ridiculously uneven with small potholes & damage to the road. Other roads around the area have been resurfaced and are smooth & easy to use, yet ours have been forgotten. Really difficult to use a pushchair as the ‘dropped curbs’ are more like raised curbs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 Holtham Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerbs falling off/terrible road, 17th May
item.description:
These kerbs have been like this for over a year since I moved in. Reported to Gloucester highways and council and they have emailed to say the problem has been fixed - however these photos are from today (15.05.2021) and they have NOT been fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 32 Holtham Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerb falling off, 17th May
item.description:
Kerb falling off - meadow way & holtham avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Meadow Way, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti in Winston Churchill Memorial Gardens, 17th May
item.description:
Pretty much everything has been tagged. The younger children’s slide in the playground. The bin by the Market Street entrance. The wall alongside the Honeybourne Line. Probably more that I haven’t noticed. I don’t believe any of it is offensive, it’s mostly tagging and meaningless drivel.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 Park Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 17th May
item.description:
Parked on roundabout junction. Need to move ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Hillview Road, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep sharp side pothole on blind bend -, 17th May
item.description:
The location is Aggs Hill where the side of the road has been eroded and in particular - a deep pothole has opened up which is almost impossible to miss when going up the hill as the bend it is on is blind. Vehicles going up the hill have swerved to miss the hole and if anything is coming down - this has made for a possible collison situation. Please can this area be filled in as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lower Hewletts Farm Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken road, 16th May
item.description:
Sunken area of road from recent gas works. Now with growing pot hole. Dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elmhurst Old Gloucester Road, Staverton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 16th May
item.description:
Two potholes - one very deep - on south side of east end road in front of and a few metres beyond Charlton kings junior school on/at pelican crossing and second one metres before ingress to glynrosa road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 East End Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Localised water drainage issue, 16th May
item.description:
Whenever there is heavy rain, a large amount of water collects at the point on Telstar Way, northbound, approximately where the two lanes coming off the roundabout merge back to a single lane. The puddle is often large enough to completely cover the left hand lane and begin to encroach on the right lane. Whether there is a blocked drain or other drainage issue, this happens frequently at this location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 GEMINI, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

At junction of Sandycroft Road
